dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Leishmania{/it}) of parasitic, flagellate protozoans that cause {d_link|leishmaniasis|leishmaniasis}, are transmitted by the bite of sand flies (genus {it}Phlebotomus{/it} and {it}Lutzomyia{/it}), and occur in an motile, extracellular form within the gut of sand flies and a nonmotile, intracellular form within the macrophages of mammalian hosts
{bc}a protozoan resembling the leishmanias that is included in the family (Trypanosomatidae) to which they belong

et: New Latin, from Sir W. B. {it}Leishman{/it} †1926 British medical officer
shortdef: any of a genus (Leishmania) of parasitic, flagellate protozoans that cause leishmaniasis, are transmitted by the bite of sand flies (genus Phlebotomus and Lutzomyia), and occur in an motile, extracellular form within the gut of sand flies and a nonmotile, intracellular form within the macrophages of mammalian hosts; broadly : a protozoan resembling the leishmanias that is included in the family (Trypanosomatidae) to which they belong
